ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: Ormenos looks ahead toward a twilight haze pouring in through the myriad trees of a forest. As he nears, though, several oddities conjure suspicions and speculations about this unique woodland. For one, not a single branch sprouts from among the trees. Their countless trunks also all seem to share a bizarrely squarish aspect.

Soon he is close enough to reach out and touch one, feeling, to his surprise, the rough and uneven edges of pages within a leatherbound tome. Stacks upon stacks of copied volumes stretch skyward higher than his eyes can see. So much knowledge here contained, but all is in utter disarray with titles sorted seemingly at random.
Ormenos then sees beyond the impostor trees to the end of the chamber, where countless doors line the walls with no clear indicator as to which lead to progress and which to nowhere.
Then, the sound of myriad beasts stampeding in perfect synchronous fills the air, signaling the Arbiter's arrival.

The room brightens, revealing a single door. Above the door, a single word reveals the result of his test...

		Sightless.

		The door opens, revealing the path back to the beginning. The road to Discipline has proven incompatible with the Inquisitor and to the entrance he must now return.
Having planted the seed of Awareness through an initiation of inquiry, Ormenos has earned the right to continue forward. But through which door..?

And in asking the question, the irrelevant miscellany begins to fade from view and into memory. The myriad stacks containing innumerable volumes all disappear into the ether; and with each stack fades a door until a single door remains...
"Knowing a fault exists is not enough. Correction is imperative for meaning to arise."
"Behold. The vast knowledge of the Enclave here lies. How many lifetimes fill these pages? How many more do not?"
"The Vanquished knew more than any now living. Their knowledge too was a small fraction of the whole."
"Thus, the second Paradox of Ignorance. A problem known is not a problem solved. Too many paths lead astray. Which one guides true?"
"Legendary Uqbar holds the key. Speak, Inquisitor, what does the word 'HRONIR' mean?"

A.response_text: "What do the people of Uqbar value most?"

B.response_text: "I'll need more than just the word to guide me."

D.response_text: "Perhaps you could give me a clue..."

E.response_text: "Just tell me what it means and get on with it."

F.response_text: "Uqbar is fictional, man; so it can mean anything we want it to."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "An unremarkable and unimaginative inquiry."
"A distillation of an entire civilization's desires is impossible."

A.response_text: "Then I ask, what works of art and artifice have they produced?"

B.response_text: "Is it an object, action, or descriptor?"

E.response_text: "Fine, then. Just tell me what it means and get on with it."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "Then ask your questions, Inquisitor."

A.response_text: "What do the people of Uqbar value most?"

B.response_text: "Is it an object, action, or descriptor?"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "Then in Ignorance's shadow you remain. Your path here ends."
"The Arbiter could, yet it is not its task to do so."
"Now ask your questions or answer mine, Inquisitor."

C.response_text: "I can't think of any questions to ask."

D.response_text: "Of course, then could you tell me how this item is used?"

E.response_text: "I tire of these games."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "The name 'Inquisitor' ill-suits you. Too arrogant to ask. Too rigid to mold. Too set to learn."
"Then you have Awareness of Uqbar and its origins."

F.response_text: "Oh, I've seen shit you wouldn't believe, Arby!"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "They have made nothing. Uqbar is a fiction. As fictitious as the HRONIR they produce."

B.response_text: "To what end do you ask these questions?"

E.response_text: "A trick, then? Do that again and we'll see if you bleed oil..."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "It is none of these. HRONIR are as fictitious as Uqbar is."

B.response_text: "To what end do you ask these questions?"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "They are not used. HRONIR are as fictitious as Uqbar is."

D.response_text: "Fascinating... Any more false trails for me?"

E.response_text: "A trick, then? Do that again and we'll see if you bleed oil..."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!AWARENESS.dialogue_text: "No ruse. No games."
"The ocean is vast. Where do you first search for fish?"
"And when you find them, a net too large may yield a big catch. Bigger than you can lift."
"Your questions decide your answers. Your answers decide your Awareness."
"The seed of Awareness is sown when the right questions are formulated. The right questions only come when questions are actually asked."
"On the Path, you will encounter many such false starts."
"No games. No tricks."
"You have passed, Inquisitor. Proceed."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text:
Courage, hidden in the depths of his Trueflesh, seems to propel him through the portal. Yet, it seems less like him walking through it and more like it walking through him. As that shimmering gate absorbs his Falseflesh, the room transforms around him, massive black panels now starting to blanket the ceiling where only rough, rocky surfaces once were. People zip by as Ormenos remains static, nearly frozen in time. The panels flicker on and off, displaying images too quickly for the mage to interpret.

		But soon, the many people become fewer; the lights flicker less and less; and finally no movement, no light at all. In a state near either sleep or death, the room awaits - the object of its waiting uncertain.

In the stationary silence, Ormenos has time to reflect on what he just witnessed. The effect is much greater, much wider-reaching even, than a simple change of decorations. No, it more closely resembles watching a boy become a man, seeing a blossom become fruit. It is seeing latent potential finally realized. This is the final stage, the inevitable outcome of the myriad chance encounters that led the mage here.

Winking into consciousness, Ormenos now notes the presence of a silver throne at the center - the inevitable fixture in all Vanquished ruins. He wonders whether it was always there and he failed to notice or if it really had just appeared. But a more pressing issue pries his thoughts away from his answerless questions: someone seems to have already be occupying this throne.

Call it a doppelganger, an illusory twin, or whatever is most convincing, but the fact is that this individual is indistinguishable from Ormenos himself. In fact, he is now both standing where the portal was and sitting in the chair at the same time. He perceives the scene from two perspectives in synchronous simultaneity, each's perception every bit as real as the other's.

Then, the enthroned Ormenos rises, as suddenly, directly in front of and in between the two bewildered magi, appears a most prodigious slope with a most imposing boulder placed atop. The boulder is of dimensions coequal to an Ormenos' height in all three planes. The slope's surprising appearance at first startles the twinned magi, though quickly they wonder if it too may have been here all along, only giving the appearance of phasing into existence when it finally drew their attention.

Queerly, both Ormenos and his mirror-self stand across the way from each other, one at the center and the other on the periphery of the presumably flat chamber, yet by some trick of magic or artifice the slope seems to ascend from both perspectives.

The boulder, nudged upwards, rhapsodically gains momentum until it careens wholeheartedly towards the recently entered Ormenos' side of the slope, from whom's perspective it seems as though the boulder is quickly rolling downward on a collision course with his fragile Falseflesh...

A.response_text: Stop the boulder before it can cause any damage.

B.response_text: Stand firm in the path of the illusory boulder - how could it not be fake?

D.response_text: Quickly jump to safety - no point in taking chances.

E.response_text: Brace for impact and then send it flying back at the idiot who sent it your way!

F.response_text: By Roostor's mighty comb, invoke the Caw of Protection!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text: Gritting his teeth and closing his eyes, Ormenos makes preparations to stop the charge of the dispassionate stone. Yet when it is but a hair's breadth away, it stops abruptly, as though time itself had frozen. The instigating Ormenos mirrors his actions as though expecting the boulder to come rolling back.

The twin Inquisitors begin to stare at one another in stupefaction, when suddenly the whirring of the Thought Wheel causes the dark panels to buzz and glow, one-by-one giving birth to an image of an Ormenos pair engaging in the simple and seemingly pointless act of repeatedly pushing boulders and staring at each other across this slope connecting them.

Ormenos stands firm in the path of the boulder as it dispassionately charges towards him, seeking to press the very marrow from his bones. Yet when it is but a hair's breadth away, it stops abruptly, as though time itself had frozen. And out of habitual curiosity, the assaulted Ormenos touches the boulder to confirm or deny its materiality. In so doing, he accidentally nudges it back toward the mirror Ormenos, who subsequently reciprocates.

Back and forth, the boulder rolls between the inquisitive twin Ormenoses. Suddenly, the whirring of the Thought Wheel causes the dark panels to hum and glow, one-by-one birthing pairs of Ormenoses engaged in the simple, and seemingly pointless, act of repeatedly rolling a boulder up and down - or is it up and up? - the slope connecting them.

Ormenos stands unconcernedly in the path of the dispassionate boulder charging at him, as it seeks to press the very marrow from his bones. Content to let the universe decide for him, he regards the massive stone orb coldly up until the very moment it is but a hair's breadth away, when it stops abruptly, as though time itself had frozen. A sudden desire to push it back compels the indifferent mage to casually nudge it back toward the other Ormenos, who in sympathetic conformity reciprocates.

Back and forth, the boulder rolls between the indifferent twin Inquisitors. Suddenly, the whirring of the Thought Wheel causes the dark panels to hum and glow, one-by-one birthing pairs of Ormenoses engaged in the simple, and seemingly pointless, act of repeatedly rolling a boulder up and down - or is it up and up? - the slope connecting them.

Diving for cover, Ormenos cowers in fear, eyes closed tighter than a miser's purse strings as the boulder dispassionately charges toward him, seeking to press the very marrow from his bones. Shivering in his mage's robes, he waits to hear the inevitable collision and obliteration of the stone upon the surface of the dome. But his expectations remain unrequited.

He looks up and his trembling ceases. The stony orb has stopped abruptly right at the base of the slope, just as though time itself had frozen. Perhaps ashamed of his cowardice, or perhaps in retribution for the mirror Ormenos' act of treachery, the slighted Ormenos kicks the boulder back towards his instigating twin. The newly threatened mage now likewise cowers in fear until the boulder stops before him, too. Then, similarly motivated by vengeance or shame, he propels the boulder back towards his assailant.

Back and forth, they cower at and thrust forth the boulder in turn. But suddenly, the whirring of the Thought Wheel causes the dark panels to hum and glow, one-by-one birthing pairs of Ormenoses engaged in the devious, and seemingly pointless, act of repeatedly hurling a boulder with ill intent, up and down - or is it up and up? - the slope connecting them.

Gritting his teeth and closing his eyes, Ormenos makes preparations to stop the charge of the dispassionate stone. Yet when it is but a hair's breadth away, it stops abruptly, as though time itself had frozen. The other Ormenos laughs derisively at his twin's weak attempt to stop the boulder.

In a fit of rage and bravado, the threatened Ormenos propels the boulder back in the direction whence it came, this time with even greater force. The throne-side Ormenos likewise braces for impact, receives mockery from the assailing Ormenos, and now, even angrier, sends the rocky sphere careening back again.

An eye for and eye and a tooth for a tooth, until all available body parts have been annihilated in turn. But suddenly, the whirring of the Thought Wheel causes the dark panels to hum and glow, one-by-one birthing pairs of Ormenoses engaged in the savage, and seemingly pointless, act of repeatedly hurling a boulder with ill intent, up and down - or is it up and up? - the slope connecting them.

Ormenos, spreads his metaphorical wings to their fullest extent and caws till his lungs prune. This, he knows instinctively, is the summoning ritual, the one act to ignite the ire of almighty Roostor!

Suddenly, the clouds part and golden rays sparkle along the silver linings, casting the silhouette of an anthropomorphic fowl in stark contrast. The Caw, so powerful, has also aroused the allies of the Skylord. Soon, the Mushroom Duke appears, charging in with his fungal army toward the dispassionate stone orb. Many fall under the crushing weight of the sphere, leaving little more than a gooey memory. All hope seems to wane as the boulder approaches, ever faster, ever closer, ever mowing down the proud knights of the Toadstool Order!
But, out of nowhere, the Master of the Skies swoops down from on high and with a mighty flap of His feathery wings, He blasts the boulder back whence it came!

In a fit of ecstasy, the throne-side Ormenos likewise invokes the most sacred of Caws, repeating this bizarre, cyclical rhapsody - a cycle which would normally continue ad infinitum, except the floral and faunal warriors appear to tire of the cycle and take breaks to smoke and gamble in between, while the stones and both Ormenoses patiently wait.
But then, at long last, the Arbiter makes its final call...

Without warning, the screens all switch to a bird's eye view of the circular chamber floor. A light soon races around the circumference from beginning to end only to start anew. Then, the screens all merge into a single gigantic view of the scene, though gradually shifting its perspective from top down to side on, revealing that the circle is not as it seems. In truth, it is an infinitely descending spiral.

The Arbiter's voice vanishes and the panels' lights begin to fade. New light rushes in to replace it through a familiar set of receding metallic scales. As these peel away, they reveal the entrance to the Path.
Then it dawns on him... There was no series of caverns and chambers at all; it was always just a single room, one now leading back to Ormenos' point of departure at the Edge of Ignorance.
Perhaps it is all just a loop after all.
"Inquisitor, you have reached the final trial. You are now at the Bittersweet Epiphany."
"You now know the true nature of the Path of Discipline. It is unending, a loop repeated. It begins where it ended and ends where it began."
"How do you respond to this circular limitation?

A.response_text: "It's only impossible until someone does it."

B.response_text: "I'll pursue knowledge for its own sake."

D.response_text: "Walking around in circles? I think I'll look for my own path instead."

E.response_text: "I'll warp the circle to a shape that suits me."

F.response_text: "Not a circle, a spiral! It says so before the Book of Eidos."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text: Perspective, Brother, is indispensable to insight."
"Without it, none achieve depth. They never even start the true Path."
"Go forth, a changed mage."
"Your Path begins now.
"...Well aren't you clever?

F.response_text: "Called it! Booyah!"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text: "Yes, you did..."

F.response_text: "Do I get a reward or something?!"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text: "Certainly."

F.response_text: "Rock on! What's my prize?!"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!BITTERSWE.dialogue_text: "Your prize is the Path's true purpose. The Path was made to..."

F.response_text: "...Yeah? Say it, machine bro!"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: MULTICHECKER

Earthen scents, the molds, the minerals; earthen sounds, the drips, the scrapes; all these, and the rough feel of a hand tracing the stony wall, illuminate what the darkness hides. Though invisible to the eye, they are not invisible to the mind. This dank hollow, carved right into the belly of the Enclave's mountain home, harbors the secret to the Order's mastery of Glyphs.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0010!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: A dull amber light ahead signals the beginning. Two crystalline sconces adorn twinned pillars, the Patrons of Wisdom's final gift before their disappearance. These gifts dwarf the mage before them, extending upward several times his height. Each bear a phrase, two sides of the same coin, their union both admonishes and encourages Enclaveans attempting the Path...

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0011!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text:
"SEEKERS OF DISCIPLINE WILL ENTER.
		LACKERS THEREOF WILL FAIL."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0012!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: The pillars frame a robust metal shutter between them. Composed of overlapping metallic sheets, it resembles the scales of some forgotten leviathan, peacefully slumbering in the depths of the mountain.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.X019!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Sources relating to the Path of Discipline are scant - odd, as every Enclavean will attempt it at some point. From what Ormenos has been able to discover, though, the Patrons of Wisdom built it at the founding of the Enclave. It was to act as a catalyst for learning, allowing magi to master multiple Glyphs - if they had the Discipline required to do so. Yet, it turned out to be surprisingly difficult for others to follow, the individual stages having neither rhyme nor reason. To this date, only a handful of magi have ever walked the Path in its entirety.

B.response_text: Start the Path
B.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.X0014!DESCRIPTION!

action.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.X00140!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: The decision made, a gradually accelerating Thought Wheel responds. Its ancient innards grind and squeal, soon giving way to the thunderous voice of the Arbiter...

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!9999.X1207!DESCRIPTION!

action.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.00141!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Having been denied access by the Arbiter, Ormenos can do nothing but vacate the premises. Though his time at the Enclave spans decades, he still has much to learn.

The frame surrounding the scaly shutter springs to luminescence, and the massive metal door begins to reveal what lays beyond. Splitting, dividing, it fragments into myriad smaller plates that are then sequentially drawn into the walls. The eerie silence breaks only when air floods in from the adjoining area, a waking giant's great exhalation. The air carries with it a distinctly odorless scent, as if suppressing all sense of smell.
MULTICHECKER

Sources relating to the Path of Discipline are scant - odd, as every Enclavean will attempt it at some point. From what Ormenos has been able to discover, though, the Patrons of Wisdom built it at the founding of the Enclave. It was to act as a catalyst for learning, allowing magi to master multiple Glyphs - if they had the Discipline required to do so. Yet, it turned out to be surprisingly difficult for others to follow, the individual stages having neither rhyme nor reason. To this date, only a handful of magi have ever walked the Path in its entirety...

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0020!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Yet only need begets effort, and the Inquisitor feels no need to expend any effort to walk the Path at the moment.

Stumbling back, swimming in the confusion and perhaps even the unfairness of the Path, Ormenos reaches the beginning. The scaly, metallic door seals itself behind him, barring him from re-entry. Arbiter lays dormant, awaiting the spark of Discipline to re-ignite within an Enclavean's Trueflesh. But for now, all Ormenos can do is retire to greener pastures.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!9990.X2070!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Having obtained the competence he desired, Ormenos returns to the beginning. Passing through the open portal, that scaly, metallic door unfolds to cover the Path anew. What lies beyond the learning of a Glyph will remain but one of many mysteries confronting this Enclavean. But for now, all Ormenos can do is retire to greener pastures.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!9990.X2070!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Countless hours of clawing through the labyrinthine tunnels finally brings Ormenos back to the beginning. Though not all was lost, for at least he returns with the Glyph his Trueflesh desired. However, what lies beyond the learning of a Glyph will remain but one of many mysteries confronting this Enclavean. For now, all Ormenos can do is retire to greener pastures.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!9990.X2070!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Ormenos walks once more through the pillars, now more aware than ever of the infinite weight of his pursuit. Rare among magi, he knows the Path of Discipline, has tamed it, has made it his own.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0060!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Though, to what end? What has he gained from this ordeal? What has he lost in sacrificing other pursuits to accomplish this feat?

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0061!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: A somewhat useless musing, he concludes, as it will merely serve to feed the already raging flame of his anxiety. Better to let such things lurk in the shadow of ignorance.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0062!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: But the Inquisitor knows his nature, if nothing else. He is only ever interested in the shadows cast by the light of Awareness. To him, that is the true meaning of Discipline - to witness, to grasp that which not even Awareness can know...

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0063!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Suddenly, the spark of recognition calls his attention back from the nether regions of thought. Before him stands the Beast Lord, a particularly savage moniker for such a learned man - typical of Enforcer Falsenames as they are.

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.X0064!DESCRIPTION!

action.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0065!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Eyes lock. Confusion from one, mirrored by the other. But then his Brother's reason for being here dawns on him. Epiphanies of this sort are what the Inquisitor lives for. Awareness birthed from Ignorance, the ecstatic bliss of sudden realization. Though short-lived it is, for the Beast Lord is here to herald this Inquisitor's end...

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!9999.X1200!DESCRIPTION!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: Feet shuffle, directed by the strings of foreign wills, toward the Nave, toward Ormenos' reckoning...

Though turned away from the Path of Discipline, Ormenos is not discouraged and returns to renew his quest. Yet Arbiter's echoing silence leaves no question as to the finality of its decision. Thus, for now, all Ormenos can do is retire to greener pastures.
"Inquisitor. Seeker of judgment. I am the Arbiter."

A.response_text: "I wish to use the Path of Discipline."
A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.001!ARBITER!

B.response_text: "I seek the wisdom of Discipline."
B.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.001!ARBITER!

C.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.003!ARBITER!

D.response_text: "And what fruits would such a judgment yield?"
D.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.003!ARBITER!

E.response_text: "No. I am judge, jury and executioner."
E.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.003!ARBITER!

F.response_text: "Depends. Do you give good fashion advice?"
F.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.001!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "To proceed, answer..."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0010!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "The Wayfarer visited Biracul in the Empyrean of old. They discussed the cult to Biracul."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0011!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "As host, Biracul poured the travel-weary Wayfarer a drink. In kind, words poured from the Wayfarer's lips."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0012!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "She stated opinions regarding the past, present, and future of the cult."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0013!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "Her speech ran long. Biracul poured throughout. The cup filled. It rejected the excess. But he poured still."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0014!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "The waste sparked the Wayfarer's ire."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0015!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "Soon, she could not stem her rage's flow. She stood violently. She rebuked mercilessly. She demanded her host stop pouring."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0016!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "Biracul complied."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0017!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "Decipher the meaning of this story. Or abandon the Path."

A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0018!ARBITER!

B.response_text: "Could you repeat it?"
B.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.0010!ARBITER!

C.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.00180!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF I.dialogue_text: "Speak your truth."

A.response_text: "Biracul is truly a gracious host and listens well."
A.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.00180!ARBITER!

B.response_text: "The Wayfarer is the cup - too full to learn."
B.dest_add: ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!EDGE OF IGNORANCE!0.00180!ARBITER!

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!FAITH'S A.dialogue_text:
As Ormenos enters this chamber of the labyrinthine Path, he sees spread out upon the floor a carpet of intricate weave, covered in an array of supple velvet pillows. Fatigue overwhelms reason, carrying him as of habit to rest a spell upon the mess of cushions.

		But there is no rest for the weary, as the now familiar whir acts as a prelude to the Arbiter's voice.

In an instant, the intricately woven carpet unravels, revealing a diminutive clone beneath, barely wider than Ormenos is tall. The pillows wither into dying memories, leaving scarcely an impression behind. The smaller carpet soon begins to levitate, elevating Ormenos with it. A hole in the floor opens beneath, allowing passage down into the chamber below. In the space of a thought, the carpet and its cargo descend.

In what can only be described as the opposite of a flash, all lights disappear. Ormenos is now left in a darkness so absolute that even shadows would lose their way in it.

		Under the current circumstances, it will take much effort merely to discover the exit, let alone return to the beginning... But what choice does he have?
"Inquisitor, your progress is remarkable."
"Does it satisfy you? Have you accomplished your purpose in walking the Path?"
"The tale of the Old Crimson Master, Hamlik will guide your answer. Have you heard it?"

B.response_text: "I have not."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!FAITH'S A.dialogue_text: "Then hearken to the tale of the Rusted Wizard, Hamlik. Even when in youth's good graces, he had already begun to walk the Path of Deceit."
"Before the Awakening, the Viridian Master crafted a ghelblade. But while he slept, it was misplaced."
"Vanargand suspected Hamlik's sticky hands. As such, he visited Hamlik to inquire."
"Denial was both expected and received. Only wit could plumb the depths of Crimson Master's sincerity."
"He asked Hamlik three plus one questions."
"'Have you seen my newly forged blade?' the Viridian Master asked."
"'I have not,' the Crimson Master replied."
"'Then, have you been in my workshop?' Vanargand followed."
"'I have not,' young Hamlik answered."
"'Then, did you take Luin?' Vanargand continued."
"'I told you, I didn't take your blade!' exclaimed the youthful trickster."
"'Then, how did you know its name?' was the Master Craftsman's final question."
"Hamlik knew he had been caught. He was summarily punished for his crime. Vanargand crafted a hideous beak and merged it with his Trueflesh in perpetuity."
"But did he abandon the Path of Deceit?"
"No. Instead, he refined and perfected it."
"Soon after the Awakening, the Viridian Master produced a beast of war. Four legs it used to crawl upon the earth. White breath it used to liquefy steel."
"This too went missing."
"Another visit paid Vanargand in search of truth. But now craftier and more skilled had Hamlik become."
"Again he offered three plus one questions. Three plus one answers he received in kind."
"'Have you seen my newly forged beast of war?' first asked the Master Craftsman."
"'I have not,' the youthful trickster replied."
"'Have you been in my workshop?' the Viridian Master followed."
"'I have not stepped foot in there recently...' came Hamlik's answer."
"'Then, did you take Gulganna?' Vanargand continued."
"'What's a Gulganna?' slyly answered the Crimson Master."
"The Master Craftsman's ruse had been stymied. He had been outwitted, outdone."
"The wisdom of 'practice' was not lost on the Hamlik. Thus, 'talent' became 'competence'. And 'competence' soon turned to 'mastery'."

He scans the surroundings, seeking an appropriate place to alight. His eyes almost immediately fall upon the unusual sight of a wide river traveling upwards along the dome. At first he believes it to be a trick of vision, but as he traces it skywards, he confirms its gravity-defying climb, as well as it ultimate disappearance into a hole at the top.

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!HUBRIS' D.dialogue_text:
Ormenos leaps, landing upon an unexpectedly solid surface with all the unchecked force of his weight bearing down on his oblivious feet. The confused mage crumples into a ball of shivering, whimpering agony, rubbing his throbbing feet, hoping nothing is broken.

		Finally, the absent whirring of the Thought Wheel makes an aural appearance...

Ormenos digs through his pockets for some unwanted item he can cast into the unknown profundity of the fluid below. Extracting a small stone replica of the Biracul, the handiwork of Cook Ding from the Refectory, he ceases his search. Though a gift rich in artistry, its purpose would best be served testing the proverbial waters. Thus, Ormenos launches it over the side of the carpet.
In the space of a thought, the statuette collides with the water, bouncing several times upon the surface before finally coming to rest against the deceitful water as though it were rock solid.
Its motion's end coincides with the beginning of the Thought Wheel's whir, interrupting this moment of shock...

Ormenos falls toward the water and unexpectedly collides with a supremely hard surface. Yet, given his relaxed descent, he merely lands on his rump, his soft hindquarters absorbing the majority of the impact for him.
He rubs at the pain, stopping mid-strike, thinking it wouldn't do anything for the pain anyway. His stroking's end coincides with the beginning of the Thought Wheel's whir...

Ormenos cautiously climbs off the carpet until he hangs over the edge, toes still several handspans from the water. Reluctantly, he lets go of the edge and falls, expecting to plunge into the unknown depths of the water...
Instead, his feet encounter a rock solid surface - a meeting that brings them no joy, but lots of pain and shock, in equal measure.

After recovering from the initial discomfort of hitting the hard floor, Ormenos muses that this is the first time he has walked on water - that he can remember, in any case. A wry smile forces pain from consciousness, and soon the Arbiter's whir interrupts his idle reverie.

He leaps, unafraid, unfettered, and completely unprepared. His body collides with the unyielding and ultimately impenetrable surface of the water. Despite the assurance of softness, this impostor water has inverted expectations in a most excruciating fashion.
The pain far exceeds his tolerance threshold. It tears through him, ravaging, clawing - yet mercifully fleeting. As the pain dissipates, the Arbiter's absent whir swoops in to replace it.

Ormenos' skull collides with the unyielding and impenetrable surface of the water, rebounding as a geyser of blood and regret erupts from his face. Despite the assurance of softness, this illusion has inverted expectations in a most excruciating fashion. What could have possessed him to perform such a risky maneuver? He wonders as darkness supplants consciousness...

...Awareness trickles in, guided by the echoes of blood dripping on stone. Ormenos feels at his wound, and though impressive, it is miraculously painless. He traces the gash, feeling none of the sticky wetness blood promises. Oddly, patting at his face reveals no blood whatsoever... His hands race back to the gash, stunned to find no trace of it. As illusory as the water that wrought it, he absently muses.

Perhaps it is best he simply forget about such poor decisions and leave them in the past. Focusing on mistakes often leads to more, after all; learning from them, may be better than obsessing over them in this case.
As the mage's musings come to a finish, the Thought Wheel fills in the void with its elegant roar...
And wait he does... but for how long?
This carpet is going nowhere fast. Thus, Ormenos muses upon the inevitable question: is there really any point in waiting?

			HE WHO UNTANGLES THIS KNOT, DISCIPLINE SHALL ATTAIN.

"The crow's raspy voice whispered of its mother, 'I am the Muninn crow, born of the great white tree in the wild woods of Zemes' Valley. Far have I traveled, abducted by the northern winds. Bring me home to my mother and she will grant you the boon of wisdom.'"

"There, he found the tree to be no ordinary tree. It was a hybrid shaped by the Intelligences. Natural energies accumulated in myriad pearly white crystals over millennia. These were in turn subsumed by the Muninn tree."

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!INEPTITUD.dialogue_text: Unflinching light locks all shadows in place. The world seems still, frozen, timeless. A feigned stillness, the mage muses, as his footsteps click on unyielding stone. His learning reminds him that sound would not be possible in a frozen world, nor would any motion be. Illusions are but shadows cast by fools facing away from the light. Odd how even the Biraculian tradition of mindless sheep espoused this belief. Oh, yes, Ormenos could still quote the Biraculian Verses. His father repeated one such verse with such frequency he practically owned it.
"All shadows are cast by the light of Awareness; and so too by its light are they banished." And its inevitable companion verse, "Stand not in the way of light and shadows disappear..."
What use is new learning if all he remembers are these old verses? Try as he may, Ormenos cannot outrun his past.
Soon, time appears to unfreeze as wispy, white tendrils seem to snake towards him through the corridor. It seems he now reaches the next chamber.
The mage plunges into a lake of cold, spectral mist. Deeper, deeper, ever deeper, he dives; and though his feet yet meet the solid stone, he soon loses any sense of direction.

Ormenos abruptly stops to think, and the mist races to catch up to his stillness. He notes the chamber lacks both the aromatic and sonic charms of the Scriptorium, yet it retains a strikingly similar atmosphere.
The fog finally settles - and with it, all motion. Soon, breathing slows; senses dull; thought stops. An end...
But suddenly, the familiar whirring of the Thought Wheel steals Ormenos' attention from his imagination, freeing him from its bonds.
The misty shroud fades into a memory, revealing a robust door in the process of folding in upon itself, in spiraling halves, until it is no more. The path is clear.
"The desire to learn is a start. But, the first Paradox of Ignorance is certain."
"Ignorance entails lacking. You do not know, hence the desire to know. Ignorance entails blindness. You do not know, hence how to learn is obscure."
"Speak then, Inquisitor. If the cube's nature is to the square undecipherable, how does the square learn this truth?"

ENCLAVE!THE PATH OF DISCIPLINE!INEPTITUD.dialogue_text: "Partial truth. The shadow cannot see its caster. But limits are learned when Awareness of them exist. Limits learned can be overcome."
"Knowledge of ignorance is the first step to understanding."
"The right questions asked, the right answers revealed. A question asked, an answer revealed. No questions asked, what hope of revelation?"
"Pass through the gate of Ineptitude's Deceit. Its only key is awareness of lack, not acceptance of it.

Perhaps his corrupting talents would prove more effective on the unsullied waters of the nearby river.
Perhaps his corrupting talents here are as the hammer is to the screw: a fine tool, but one ill-suited to the task. In truth, Ormenos requires a different approach to revive this rotten pool...
Standing before the stagnant pool, Ormenos chooses to...

B.response_text: __Use Putrefaction Techne__
